column4: Ubuntu keeps suddenly freezing out of nowhere. it's getting quite frequent.
check your logs to see what happens before/when it freezes
i am, but theres like 1000 log files haha. still checking
you can filter them by date, as well as use the "tail" function to check the last X number of lines from a file.  Grep is good for filtering results to a specific date/time window as well.
learn some of the CLI stuff, it goes so much quicker and offers so much more finesse for finding the right entries
especially with grep you can use the -A and -B options to pull in lines around (before and after) ones that match
yes i suspect its the gpu. its OLD and gets HOT
have you cleaned it lately to make sure the fan isn't being clogged by dust?
got any arctic silver around and feeling ambitious?  You could reseat the heatsink on your gpu for better heat conduction :)

do you notice it freezing during specific functions or is it more or less random?  Is the computer on the same circuit in your home as other power hungry devices?  Air conditioners can cause big fluctuations in power.

the biggest priority overall is finding the right logs for before it freezes.  If its software related, or the system logs hardware probs before freezing, it will show up there.  If there's nothing in the logs, it's most likely hardware alone.
dont think its software. couldnt find anything in the logs. at 01:44

in that case trying a ghetto-cooling method like loshki mentioned might help.  try taking the side off the computer, make sure its not stuck in a tight cabinet, and possibly put a box or desk fan near it to help it disperse the ambient heat
normally I'd recommend benchmarking software for stress testing but I'm not familiar with the linux options there
I think I've heard about a new bus but frankly I haven't been keeping up to date on the hardware side of things either lately
